com.lithium.community.android.ui.components.fragments

Class LiBaseFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • DialogFragment
      • com.lithium.community.android.ui.components.fragments.LiBaseFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LiBrowseFragment, LiConversationFragment, LiMessageListFragment, LiSearchFragment, LiUserActivityFragment

    public abstract class LiBaseFragment
extends DialogFragment
    This fragment is an abstract base class which takes care of getting appropriate LiClient, fetching data, setup the common views and a common error layout. This is to reuse the views that are present in most of the fragments There are abstract methods which need to be implemented by the concrete Fragment for poplulating the data, getting respective API Providers and adapters. The base fragment also consists of the BroadcastReceiver which receives the login complete event broadcasted by coreSDK Implements android.support.v4.widget.SwipeRefreshLayout.OnRefreshListener to handle refresh listener which takes care of updating the main content after the user has been logged in successfully.

    • Method Detail

      • getClient

        protected abstract void getClient()
                           throws LiRestResponseException
        BaseFragment doesn't know about which client to be used. Hence this is an abstract method which must be implemented by the concrete class
        Throws:
        LiRestResponseException

      • getAdapter

        protected abstract RecyclerView.Adapter getAdapter()
        This method returns the respective adapter from concrete fragment implementation
        Returns:
        RecyclerView.Adapter

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)

      • onPause

        public void onPause()

      • onResume

        public void onResume()

      • populateData

        protected void populateData()
        Check if the network is available or not, If the user is logged in or not. If not then refresh the UI else go ahead and fetch the data from server

      • onRefresh

        public void onRefresh()

      • refreshUI

        public void refreshUI()
        Refresh teh UI views after the fetch is complete. If no results then show and empty view. If results are present then set the result in the respective adapter

      • setupViews

        protected android.view.View setupViews(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                       android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                       int errorTextRes,
                                       int errorBtnTextRes,
                                       android.view.View.OnClickListener clickListener,
                                       int errorBtnVisibilityCode)
        Setup the views for the fragment. This methods takes in the View that needs to be inflated and attach behaviors to the common error layout since this is the common view shared across multiple fragments
        Parameters:
        inflater - LayoutInflater
        container - ViewGroup container
        errorTextRes - Text Resource for Error TextView for inflating the error layout
        errorBtnTextRes - Text Resource for Error Button for inflating the error layout
        clickListener - Click listener for the Error Button (if any) else this would be null
        errorBtnVisibilityCode - View Visibility code which will define if the error button needs to be shown or not
        Returns:

      • setupViews

        protected void setupViews(android.view.View view,
                          int errorTextRes,
                          int errorBtnTextRes,
                          android.view.View.OnClickListener errorBtnClickListener,
                          int errorBtnVisibilityCode)
        Setup the views for the fragment. This methods takes in the View that needs to be inflated and attach behaviors to the common error layout since this is the common view shared across multiple fragments
        Parameters:
        view - View that needs to be inflated
        errorTextRes - Text Resource for Error TextView for inflating the error layout
        errorBtnTextRes - Text Resource for Error Button for inflating the error layout
        errorBtnClickListener - Click listener for the Error Button (if any) else this would be null
        errorBtnVisibilityCode - View Visibility code which will define if the error button needs to be shown or not

      • setupErrorMessage

        protected void setupErrorMessage()
        Sets up the error message and error layout behavior based upon if the network is available or not. Or if the user is still logged in or not. If Network is not present then show "Internet not available" text with a Retry button If User is not logged in then show "User not logged in" text with a Login button

      • showUserNotLoggedIn

        protected void showUserNotLoggedIn()

      • showEmptyView

        protected void showEmptyView(boolean showEmptyView)
        Shows or hides the error layout
        Parameters:
        showEmptyView - whether the error layout should be hidden or shown

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()

      • fetchData

        protected void fetchData()
        Fetch the data from the server using LiClient.processAsync method. If the network is not available then show error layout.
